lines.text: Energy moving from one object (or system) to another
P = power, W = work, ∆E = energy transfer, ∆t = elapsed time

secText:
Lesson:
1. Define [OBJ:expsec_f975:conservation of energy].
2. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_conservation_energy_rocket_question:calculate the velocity of an object] using conservation of energy.
3. [OBJ:actsec_yr40:Jump through hoops] using conservation of energy.
4. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_penny_off_Taipei_101_question:calculate the velocity of an object] using conservation of energy and motion equations.
5. [OBJ:expsec_f981:Determine how energy can transfer] from one system to another.
6. Define and calculate [OBJ:expsec_f982:power].
7. Calculate [OBJ:expsec_f983:power using force and velocity].
8. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_Niagara_Falls_power_question:calculate the power generated] by a system.

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37454:Calculate] the kinetic energy of an object using conservation of energy.
2. [OBJ:qc_37453:Calculate] the velocity of an object using conservation of energy.
3. [OBJ:qc_37450:Calculate] the power of a system.
